PC Japanese (JP): 一度、紗音にその淹れ方で飲ませてあげたことがあったが、……おいしいけど、少し濃いですね。と言われたことがあったような…。
Russian (RU): ......Похоже, излюбленный моей матерью метод приготовления кофе не пользовался спросом у каждого. Однажды я дал попробовать Шаннон, но она сказала мне, что хоть вкус и восхитительный, но он довольно крепкий...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma vez, fiz a Shannon beber um pouco do café que preparei com esse método, ......mas ela me disse que, ainda que estivesse delicioso, era um pouco forte, se eu bem me lembro das palavras dela...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我曾讓紗音喝過一次，用這種泡法衝的咖啡，……不過她好像是說了。挺好喝的，但就是有點太濃了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我曾让纱音喝过一次，用这种泡法冲的咖啡，……不过她好像是说了。挺好喝的，但就是有点太浓了…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Pareva che non tutti apprezzassero il metodo ortodosso con cui mia Madre lo preparava. Una volta, l'avevo fatto provare a Shannon... ma lei mi aveva detto che per quanto fosse delizioso, era un po' forte...

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Traditional (CHT): [=JPC]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Shannon...

Umineko Project (UP): It's no good... ......Even though I left the room to change my mood, ...that image of Shannon's face that's filling my head hasn't faded in the slightest...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's no good.........even though I left the room to change my mood, ...that image of Shannon's face that's filling my head hasn't faded in the slightest...
PC Japanese (JP): 駄目だ…。……気分を変えるために部屋を出たのに、…僕の頭の中をいっぱいに満たす紗音の面影は、わずかほども薄れない…。
Russian (RU): Так не пойдёт... Я ведь даже вышел из комнаты, чтобы сменить настроение, но образ лица Шаннон, заполнивший все мои мысли, нисколько не поблек...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso não é bom... ......Mesmo que eu tenha deixado o quarto para mudar meu humor, ...aquela imagem do rosto da Shannon que está preenchendo minha cabeça não se esvaiu nem um pouco...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不行…。……明明是為了換心情出的房間，…可充滿我腦中的紗音的面容，連一丁點都沒有褪去…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不行…。……明明是为了换心情出的房间，…可充满我脑中的纱音的面容，连一丁点都没有褪去…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Così non va bene... pur avendo lasciato la stanza per tirarmi su... l'immagine del volto di Shannon che mi riempie la mente non si è affievolita nemmeno un po'...

Steam (ST): I keep seeing those fun days with her, more and more vividly, ......and it's saddening that I never even got a chance to see her dead face.
Umineko Project (UP): The fun days I shared with her were becoming more and more vivid, ............and I felt saddened that I was not even allowed to see her dead face.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The fun days with her are repeating vividly, ............and it's saddening that I haven't even been able to see her dead face.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼女との楽しかった日々が、繰り返し鮮明になり、…………未だ、彼女の死に顔すら見させてもらえないことが、悲しかった。
Russian (RU): Весёлые дни с ней ярко пробегают мимо... И как горько, что я не могу даже увидеть её мёртвого лица.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os dias divertidos que compartilhei com ela estavam se tornando mais e mais vívidos, ............e me senti entristecido que não me fosse permitido sequer ver o rosto do seu corpo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 與她共度的快樂時光，隨著反覆閃現，變得越來越鮮明，…………內心還在為，連想看她的遺容都不被允許，而感到難過。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 与她共度的快乐时光，随着反复闪现，变得越来越鲜明，…………内心还在为，连想看她的遗容都不被允许，而感到难过。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I giorni divertenti trascorsi con lei vi si ripetono, vividi... e mi rattrista non aver potuto nemmeno vedere il suo volto dopo la morte.

Steam (ST): According to our parents, she was apparently killed with something like a gun or a spear.
Umineko Project (UP): According to our parents, it seems as though she was killed with something like a gun or spear.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): According to our parents, it seems as though she was killed with something like a gun or spear.
PC Japanese (JP): 親たちの話によれば、銃か槍のようなもので殺されたらしいという。
Russian (RU): Согласно нашим родителям, похоже, она была убита каким‐то ружьём или копьём.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De acordo com nossos pais, parece que ela foi morta com algo similar a uma arma de fogo ou uma lança.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 據長輩們所說，她似乎是被槍械或矛之類的凶器所殺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 据长辈们所说，她似乎是被枪械或矛之类的凶器所杀。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Stando a quanto hanno detto i nostri genitori, sembra sia stata uccisa con un fucile o un pugnale.

Steam (ST): ...I'm sure they were just trying to console me, ...but they had said her dead face had been very beautiful and peaceful.
Umineko Project (UP): ...I'm sure they were just trying to console me, ......but they had said that her face in death had been very beautiful and peaceful.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...I'm sure they were just trying to console me, ......but they had said that her dead face had been very beautiful and peaceful.
PC Japanese (JP): …もちろん慰めだろうが、……とても綺麗で安らかな死に顔だと言っていた。
Russian (RU): ...Я уверен, они лишь пытались меня утешить... но они говорили, что её мёртвое лицо было очень красивым и умиротворённым.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Tenho certeza que estavam só tentando me consolar, ......mas eles tinham dito que o rosto dela na morte tinha sido muito belo e pacífico.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …雖說肯定是安慰，……但照他們所說，紗音留下了非常漂亮安詳的遺容。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …虽说肯定是安慰，……但照他们所说，纱音留下了非常漂亮安详的遗容。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Sono certo che volessero solo consolarmi... ma hanno detto che il suo viso era bellissimo e avvolto dalla pace.

Steam (ST): I wonder if she had the engagement ring I gave her last night...on her finger.
Umineko Project (UP): I wonder if she's...wearing the engagement ring I gave her last night?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I wonder if she put the engagement ring I gave her last night, ...on her finger?
PC Japanese (JP): 彼女はその指に、…僕が昨夜贈った、あの婚約指輪をしてくれているだろうか。
Russian (RU): Интересно, а надела ли она обручальное кольцо, что я подарил ей вчера вечером... на свой палец?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Me pergunto se ela estava...usando o anel de noivado que dei a ela noite passada?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她的手指上，…有沒有戴著我昨晚送的，那枚訂婚戒指呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她的手指上，…有没有戴着我昨晚送的，那枚订婚戒指呢？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Mi chiedo se l'anello di fidanzamento che le ho dato ieri notte... l'abbia messo al dito?

Steam (ST): ...If she accepted my engagement, she should have had it on the ring finger of her left hand...
Umineko Project (UP): ......If she accepted my engagement, she should have it on the ring finger of her left hand...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......If she had accepted my engagement, she should have put it on the ring finger of her left hand...
PC Japanese (JP): ……僕の婚約を受けてくれたなら、左手の薬指にしているはず…。
Russian (RU): ......Если бы она приняла моё предложение, то надела бы его на свой безымянный палец левой руки...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Se ela aceitou meu noivado, ela devia tê‐lo no dedo anelar de sua mão esquerda...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……如果接受了我的求婚的話，應該會戴在左手的無名指上…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……如果接受了我的求婚的话，应该会戴在左手的无名指上…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Se aveva accettato la mia proposta, dovrebbe averlo messo all'anulare sinistro...

Steam (ST): Last night, we were both on the edge of losing it and not calm at all.
Umineko Project (UP): Last night, our heads were both full of each other, and we weren't composed at all.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Last night, we were both on the edge of losing it, and not calm at all.
PC Japanese (JP): 昨夜は僕たちものぼせ上がっていて冷静じゃなかった。
Russian (RU): Вчера вечером мы были близки к впадению в панику и не могли сохранять спокойствие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Noite passada, nossas cabeças estavam ambas preenchidas um com o outro, e com certeza não estávamos muito calmos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 昨晚，我們兩人全都興奮得暈頭轉向，很不冷靜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 昨晚，我们两人全都兴奋得晕头转向，很不冷静。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La scorsa notte, eravamo entrambi molto nervosi, senza un briciolo di calma.

Steam (ST): Shannon accepted my engagement pretty courageously, but she might have regretted that as a rash action once she cooled her head. She might have taken the ring off.
Umineko Project (UP): Shannon had accepted the engagement semi‐boldly, but she might have regretted that as a rash action once she cooled her head. She might have taken the ring off.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon had accepted the engagement courageously, but she might have regretted that as a rash action once she cooled her head. She might have taken the ring off.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音は半ば勇ましく婚約を受けてはくれたけど、頭を冷やしたらそれが勇み足だったと後悔しているかもしれない。指輪を外しているかもしれない。
Russian (RU): Шаннон отважно приняла помолвку, но возможно, потом она могла пожалеть о своём поспешном решении, когда немного остудила голову. Она могла снять кольцо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Shannon tinha aceito o noivado meio que bravamente, mas ela podia ter se arrependido daquilo como uma ação precipitada depois de esfriar sua cabeça.{n}Ela podia ter tirado o anel.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然紗音頗具勇氣地接受了婚約，但等頭腦冷靜下來後，說不定會為自己的草率感到後悔。說不定會摘下戒指。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然纱音颇具勇气地接受了婚约，但等头脑冷静下来后，说不定会为自己的草率感到后悔。说不定会摘下戒指。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Shannon ha accettato il fidanzamento con coraggio, ma forse dopo essersi calmata, se n'è pentita considerandola un'azione avventata. È possibile che abbia tolto l'anello.

Steam (ST): ...I wonder if she has the ring on now.
Umineko Project (UP): ......I wonder if she has the ring on now.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……她此刻，有没有戴着戒指呢？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Mi chiedo se adesso l'abbia indosso.

Steam (ST): ...I want to be sure of at least that much. I want to know how she felt...at the very end...
Umineko Project (UP): ......I at least want to be sure of that much.{n}I want to know...her final feelings......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......I at least want to be sure of that much. I want to know...her final feelings......
PC Japanese (JP): ……せめて、それだけでも確かめたい。紗音の最後の気持ちが、知りたい……。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……せめて、それだけでも確かめたい。{n}紗音の最後の気持ちが、知りたい……。
Russian (RU): ......По крайней мере, я хотел бы окончательно убедиться.{n}Я хочу узнать... её последние чувства.....
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Quero pelo menos ter certeza desse tanto.{n}Quero saber...os sentimentos finais dela......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……哪怕只是讓我確認一下這個也好。{n}我想知道，紗音最後的心意……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……哪怕只是让我确认一下这个也好。{n}我想知道，纱音最后的心意……。

Umineko Project (UP): However, ......even if I do check that, ...it's not as if she'll be revived.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，……就算确认完这点，…她也没有可能复活。

Steam (ST): ......I wonder what will happen to her body. After the autopsy, ...it will probably be immediately cremated.
Umineko Project (UP): ...............I wonder what will happen to her body.{n}After the autopsy, ......it will probably be immediately cremated.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ............I wonder what will happen to her body. After the autopsy, ......it will probably be immediately cremated.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...............Me pergunto o que acontecerá ao corpo dela.{n}Depois da autópsia, ......ele provavelmente será cremado imediatamente.

Steam (ST): Then, I'll never be able to see her face, ...even her dead face, for all eternity...
Umineko Project (UP): Then, I'll never be able to see her face, ...even her dead face, for all eternity...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, I'll never be able to see her face, ...even her dead face, for all eternity...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, nunca serei capaz de ver o rosto dela, ...nem seu rosto morto, por toda a eternidade...

Umineko Project (UP): ".................. .........Haha, ...because of the shock of losing Shannon, ......am I going a little crazy...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".....................Haha, ...because of the shock of losing Shannon, ......am I going a little crazy...?"

Steam (ST): I don't want...her body to be burned. If she's burned and turned to ash, ...never again {i:will it be possible for her to revive}.
Umineko Project (UP): I don't want......Shannon's body to be burned.{n}If she's burned, she'll turn to ash, ......and {i:never again will it be possible for her to revive}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I don't want, ......to burn Shannon's body. If she is burned, she'll turn to ash, ......and never again will it be possible for her to revive.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音の遺体を、……焼かれたくない。焼かれれば灰になって、……彼女は二度と、{i:蘇れない}。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 紗音の遺体を、……焼かれたくない。{n}焼かれれば灰になって、……彼女は二度と、{i:蘇れない}。
Russian (RU): Я не хочу... чтобы тело Шаннон сжигали.{n}Когда её сожгут, она обратится в пепел... и ей больше никогда {i:не представится возможность воскреснуть}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não quero......que o corpo de Shannon seja queimado.{n}Se for queimada, virará cinzas, ......e {i:nunca será possível para ela reviver de novo}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不希望紗音的遺體，……被燒掉。{n}燒掉化為灰以後，……她就再也無法，{i:復活了}。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不希望纱音的遗体，……被烧掉。{n}烧掉化为灰以后，……她就再也无法，{i:复活了}。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non voglio... bruciare il corpo di Shannon. Se venisse bruciata, diventerebbe cenere... e mai più sarà possibile riportarla in vita .

Steam (ST): They say cremation is frowned upon in Western tradition. ...Because on the day of resurrection, there would be no body to revive.
Umineko Project (UP): They say that cremation is disliked in Western tradition.{n}......Because on the day of resurrection, there would be no body to revive.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They say that cremation is disliked in western tradition.......Because on the day of resurrection, there would be no body to revive.
PC Japanese (JP): 西洋の習慣では火葬は嫌われているという。……復活の日に、蘇るべき体がなくなってしまうからだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 西洋の習慣では火葬は嫌われているという。{n}……復活の日に、蘇るべき体がなくなってしまうからだ。
Russian (RU): Я слышал, что кремация не приветствуется в западных традициях.{n}......Поскольку в день воскресения тело не сможет воскреснуть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dizem que cremação é detestada pelos costumes ocidentais.{n}......Porque no dia da ressurreição não haveria corpo para reviver.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 據說，按西方的習俗，是忌諱火葬的。{n}……因為，那樣會在復活之日裡，沒有身體可供復活。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 据说，按西方的习俗，是忌讳火葬的。{n}……因为，那样会在复活之日里，没有身体可供复活。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dicono che la cremazione non venga apprezzata nella cultura occidentale. ... Perché nel giorno della resurrezione, non ci sarebbe alcun corpo da riportare alla vita.

Steam (ST): Because of that, it seems that great criminals in Western history were often cremated after execution as a punishment, and their ashes were sometimes scattered in rivers and such...
Umineko Project (UP): Because of that, it seems that great criminals in Western history were often cremated after execution as a punishment, and their ashes were sometimes scattered in rivers and such...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because of that, it seems that great criminals in western history were often cremated after execution as a punishment, and their ashes were sometimes scattered in rivers and such...
PC Japanese (JP): だから、西洋の歴史的な大罪人は、多くの場合、懲罰的な意味で処刑後に火葬されて、川などに散骨されることが多いらしい…。
Russian (RU): В связи с этим, по‐видимому, большинство преступников в западной истории, часто кремировали в качестве посмертного наказания, а прах развеивали над рекой или что‐то в этом роде...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por causa disso, parece que grandes criminosos na história ocidental geralmente eram cremados depois da execução, como uma punição, e suas cinzas costumavam ser espalhadas em rios...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，似乎西方歷史上的大罪人，在大多數情況下，都會以懲罰的意義，在處刑後火葬，骨灰撒於河川之類的場所…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，似乎西方历史上的大罪人，在大多数情况下，都会以惩罚的意义，在处刑后火葬，骨灰撒于河川之类的场所…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per questo motivo, pare che i peggiori criminali della storia occidentale venissero spesso cremate dopo essere stati puniti con la pena capitale, e le loro ceneri erano talvolta disperse in fiumi o via dicendo...

Steam (ST): In other words, to Western people, death is nothing more than a sleep until the resurrection. It is essential that the corpse is left after death.
Umineko Project (UP): In other words, to Western people, death is nothing more than a sleep until the resurrection. It is essential that the corpse is left after death.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, to western people, death is nothing more than a sleep until the resurrection. It is essential that the corpse is left after death.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、西洋人にとって、死は復活までの間の眠りでしかない。死後にも体を残しておくことが重要なのだ。
Russian (RU): Иными словами, для западных людей смерть — это не более чем сон до воскрешения. Очень важно, чтобы труп оставался после смерти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em outras palavras, para os ocidentais, a morte é nada mais que um sono até a ressurreição. É essencial que o cadáver seja deixado após a morte.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 換言之，對西方人來說，死只是復活之前的沉眠。死後留下身體，是一件很重要的事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 换言之，对西方人来说，死只是复活之前的沉眠。死后留下身体，是一件很重要的事。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In breve, per gli occidentali, la morte non è altro che un sonno che dura fino alla resurrezione. È essenziale che il cadavere sia preservato dopo la morte.

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "In other words, that's because... ...Western people... ......knew of a miracle that can revive the dead. .........But that miracle didn't exist in Japan, so we burn them."
Umineko Project (UP): "In other words, ......that's because Western people......knew of the existence of......a miracle to revive the dead. .........But that miracle didn't exist in Japan, so we burn them."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "In other words, that's because, ......western people, ......knew of the existence of a miracle to revive the dead. .........But because that miracle doesn't exist in Japan, we burn them."
PC Japanese (JP): 「つまりそれは、……西洋人は、……死者が蘇る奇跡の存在を、…知っていたからなんだ。………でも日本にはその奇跡がなかったから、焼いてしまうんだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「つまりそれは、……西洋人は、……死者が蘇る奇跡の存在を、…知っていたからなんだ。………でも日本にはその奇跡がなかったから、焼いてしまうんだ」
Russian (RU): "Другими словами, это связано с тем, что... Западным людям было известно о существовании чуда воскрешения мёртвых. .........Но поскольку этого самого чуда не существует в Японии, мы сжигаем их."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Em outras palavras, ......isso é porque os ocidentais......sabiam da existência de......um milagre para reviver os mortos. .........Mas esse milagre não existe no Japão, então nós os queimamos."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「換言之，這就是指，……西方人，……知道存在著，…死者復活的奇跡。………但是，日本沒有這個奇跡，所以會將遺體燒掉。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「换言之，这就是指，……西方人，……知道存在着，…死者复活的奇迹。………但是，日本没有这个奇迹，所以会将遗体烧掉。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "In altre parole, il motivo è che... gli occidentali... sapevano dell'esistenza di un miracolo per rivivere i morti. ... Ma dato che tale miracolo non esiste in Giappone, noi li cremiamo."

Steam (ST): Now I understand. ...I understand why Grandfather idolized the Western occult.
Umineko Project (UP): Now I understand. ...I understand why Grandfather idolized the Western occult.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Now I understand. ...I understand why Grandfather idolized the western occult.
PC Japanese (JP): 今こそわかる。…なぜお祖父さまが西洋のオカルトに傾倒したのか。
Russian (RU): Теперь я понимаю. ...Я понимаю, почему дедушка боготворил западный оккультизм.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Agora eu entendo. ...Entendo porque o vovô idolatrava o ocultismo ocidental.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 到現在，我也明白了。…明白了爺爺為什麼會傾倒於西方神秘學。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 到现在，我也明白了。…明白了爷爷为什么会倾倒于西方神秘学。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Adesso capisco. ... Comprendo perché il Nonno idolatrava la tradizione occulta occidentale.

Steam (ST): That was his only reason from the very beginning. ...Just to revive the person dear to him, ...Grandfather spent the rest of his remaining life researching the Western occult.
Umineko Project (UP): From the beginning, it had all been only for that reason. ...Just to revive the person dear to him, ...Grandfather spent the rest of his remaining life researching the Western occult.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): From the beginning, it had all been only for that reason....Just to revive the person dear to him, ...Grandfather spent the rest of his remaining life researching the western occult.
PC Japanese (JP): 最初から全て、その為だけなのだ。…愛しい人を蘇らせるためだけに、…お祖父さまは生涯の残り全てを西洋オカルトの研究に費やした。
Russian (RU): С самого начала, всё это было лишь по этой причине. ...Лишь для того, чтобы оживить лицо дорогого ему человека... дедушка посвятил всю свою оставшуюся жизнь исследованию западного оккультизма.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Do início, tinha sido tudo apenas por essa razão. ...Apenas para reviver a pessoa querida para ele, ...o vovô passou o restante de sua vida pesquisando o ocultismo ocidental.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從一開始起，就全都是為了這個。…爺爺將餘生全部耗費在了西方神秘學的研究中，…僅僅是為了令深愛之人復活。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从一开始起，就全都是为了这个。…爷爷将余生全部耗费在了西方神秘学的研究中，…仅仅是为了令深爱之人复活。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sin dall'inizio, è stato tutto per quella singola ragione. ... Solo per resuscitare la persona a lui cara... il Nonno ha trascorso ciò che restava della sua vita studiando l'occulto dell'occidente.

Steam (ST): ......The situation surrounding us now is abnormal.
Umineko Project (UP): .........The situation surrounding us right now was abnormal.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........Now, the situation surrounding us is abnormal.
PC Japanese (JP): ………今、僕たちを取り巻く状況は異常だ。
Russian (RU): .........Сейчас мы находимся в совершенно безумной ситуации.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........A situação nos cercando agora mesmo era anormal.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………此刻，我們身處的狀況十分異常。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………此刻，我们身处的状况十分异常。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... In questo momento, ci troviamo in una situazione anomala.

Steam (ST): Grandfather did revive his beloved {f:5:Beatrice}.
Umineko Project (UP): Grandfather had revived his beloved {f:5:Beatrice}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Grandfather revived his beloved Beatrice.
PC Japanese (JP): お祖父さまは愛しいベアトリーチェを蘇らせた。
Russian (RU): Дедушка возродил свою любимую {f:5:Беатриче}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O vovô tinha revivido sua amada {f:5:Beatrice}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 爺爺復活了他深愛的貝阿朵莉切。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 爷爷复活了他深爱的贝阿朵莉切。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il Nonno ha riportato in vita la sua amata Beatrice.

Steam (ST): ...And, that {f:5:Beatrice} has carried out a terrible serial murder, with linked closed rooms that force us to conclude that magic was used.
Umineko Project (UP): ...And that {f:5:Beatrice} had carried out a terrible serial murder, with chains of locked rooms that were impossible without the use of magic.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...And, that Beatrice has carried out a terrible serial murder, with linked closed rooms which forced us to think that magic had been used.
PC Japanese (JP): …そして、そのベアトリーチェは恐ろしい連続殺人事件を、魔法でも使わなければ考えられない連鎖密室にて行なった。
Russian (RU): ...И эта {f:5:Беатриче} совершила серию чудовищных убийств, связала их с закрытыми помещениями и тем самым заставила нас думать, что была использована магия.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...E aquela {f:5:Beatrice} tinha executado um assassinato em série terrível, com cadeias de quartos fechados que eram impossíveis sem o uso de magia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …然後，這位貝阿朵莉切以不用魔法就不可能做得到的連環密室，犯下了可怕的連續殺人事件。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …然后，这位贝阿朵莉切以不用魔法就不可能做得到的连环密室，犯下了可怕的连续杀人事件。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... E, quella stessa Beatrice ha commesso una terribile serie di omicidi, con stanze chiuse intrecciate l'una all'altra che ci hanno spinti a credere che fossero opera della magia.

Steam (ST): ...The Golden Witch, {f:5:Beatrice}. The incarnation of the miracle of the Western occult. ......And also, the culprit who killed Shannon...
Umineko Project (UP): ......The Golden Witch, {f:5:Beatrice}.{n}The incarnation of the miracle of the Western occult.{n}.........And also, the culprit who killed Shannon......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......The Golden Witch, Beatrice. The incarnation of the miracle of the western occult..........And also, the culprit who killed Shannon......
PC Japanese (JP): ……黄金の魔女、ベアトリーチェ。西洋オカルトの奇跡を具現した存在。………そして、紗音を殺した犯人でもある……。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……黄金の魔女、ベアトリーチェ。{n}西洋オカルトの奇跡を具現した存在。{n}………そして、紗音を殺した犯人でもある……。
Russian (RU): ......Золотая Ведьма {f:5:Беатриче}.{n}Воплощённое чудо западного оккультизма.{n}.........И кроме того, преступница убившая Шаннон...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A Bruxa Dourada, {f:5:Beatrice}.{n}A encarnação do milagre do ocultismo ocidental.{n}.........E também a culpada que matou a Shannon......

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……黄金的魔女，贝阿朵莉切。{n}西洋神秘学具现化后的存在。{n}………并且，还是杀害纱音的凶手……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... La Strega Dorata, Beatrice. L'incarnazione del miracolo dell'occultismo occidentale. ... E allo stesso tempo, il colpevole che ha ucciso Shannon...

Steam (ST): She's an entity I should hate, ......and yet, for some reason, I want to cling to her.
Umineko Project (UP): I should hate that being, ............and yet, for some reason, I want to cling to the hope she represents.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I should hate that being, ............and yet, for some reason, I want to cling to her.
PC Japanese (JP): 憎い存在のはずなのに、…………なのになぜか、彼女にすがりたい気持ちがある。
Russian (RU): Я ненавижу это создание... И всё же, у меня остаются причины обратиться к ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu devia odiar aquele ser, ............e ainda assim, por alguma razão, quero me agarrar à esperança que ela representa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 明明是個可憎的存在，…………但不知為何，心中涌起了一股，想要仰仗她的念頭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 明明是个可憎的存在，…………但不知为何，心中涌起了一股，想要仰仗她的念头。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dovrei odiare quella creatura... eppure, chissà per quale ragione, voglio aggrapparmi a lei.

Steam (ST): I wonder...if Shannon could be revived with the magic of miracles, which Grandfather bet his life on...
Umineko Project (UP): I wonder if she could use that miraculous magic that Grandfather spent his life espousing...to revive Shannon...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I wonder, ...if Shannon could be revived with the magic of miracles, which Grandfather bet his life on...
PC Japanese (JP): お祖父さまが、生涯讃え続けたその奇跡の魔法で、…紗音を蘇らせてはくれないだろうか…。
Russian (RU): Я всё гадаю... Возможно ли воскресить Шаннон с помощью магии чуда, на которую дедушка поставил свою жизнь...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Me pergunto se ela poderia usar essa magia milagrosa que o vovô passou sua vida louvando...para reviver a Shannon...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她會不會以爺爺讚頌了一生的奇跡魔法，…幫我復活紗音呢…？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她会不会以爷爷赞颂了一生的奇迹魔法，…帮我复活纱音呢…？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Mi chiedo... se Shannon possa essere resuscitata con la magia dei miracoli, su cui il Nonno ha scommesso la sua esistenza...

Steam (ST): According to the legend of the Ushiromiya family, Grandfather met with her long ago and was given a vast quantity of gold.
Umineko Project (UP): According to the Ushiromiya family legend, Grandfather met with her long ago, and was given a vast quantity of gold.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): According to the legend of the Ushiromiya family, Grandfather met with her long ago, and was given a vast quantity of gold.
PC Japanese (JP): 右代宮家の伝説によるならば、お祖父さまは昔、彼女に出会い、莫大な黄金を授けられたという。
Russian (RU): Согласно легенде семьи Уширомия, дедушка давно уже встречался с ней и ему было даровано огромное количество золота.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De acordo com a lenda da família Ushiromiya, o vovô a encontrou muito tempo atrás, e ela lhe deu uma vasta quantidade de ouro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 根據右代宮家的傳說，爺爺是在很久以前，遇見了她，獲授了巨額的黃金。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 根据右代宫家的传说，爷爷是在很久以前，遇见了她，获授了巨额的黄金。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Secondo la leggenda della famiglia Ushiromiya, il Nonno la incontrò molto tempo fa, e gli fu concessa una vasta quantità d'oro.

Steam (ST): ...Then, if I also met with her, ...instead of gold, would she give me Shannon's life?
Umineko Project (UP): ...Then if I also met her, ......instead of gold, would she give me Shannon's life?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Then if I also meet her, ......instead of gold, would she give me Shannon's life?
PC Japanese (JP): …ならば僕も彼女に出会い、……黄金ではなく、紗音の命を授けてはくれないだろうか。
Russian (RU): ...Тогда если я тоже встречусь с ней... сможет ли она вернуть мне жизнь Шаннон вместо золота?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Então, se eu também encontrá‐la, ......em vez de ouro, ela me daria a vida da Shannon?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …那麼，我是不是，也可以去與她見面，……不要黃金，而要紗音的生命呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): …那么，我是不是，也可以去与她见面，……不要黄金，而要纱音的生命呢？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Dunque se anche io la incontrassi... invece dell'oro, potrebbe darmi la vita di Shannon?

Steam (ST): As collateral, I don't care what sort of devil's contract she imposed. I wouldn't mind sacrificing all of my remaining life...
Umineko Project (UP): In return, she could impose any kind of devil's contract.{n}For that, I would sacrifice all of my remaining life...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As collateral, she could impose any kind of devil's contract. For that, I could sacrifice all of my remaining life...
PC Japanese (JP): その見返りに、どのような悪魔の契約を課せられてもいい。その為に、残りの生涯の全てを奉げることになってもいい…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その見返りに、どのような悪魔の契約を課せられてもいい。{n}その為に、残りの生涯の全てを奉げることになってもいい…。
Russian (RU): В качестве платы она может требовать заключения любого дьявольского договора.{n}Ради этого я готов пожертвовать всю свою оставшуюся жизнь...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em troca, ela podia impor qualquer tipo de contrato diabólico.{n}Para isso, eu sacrificaria toda a minha vida restante...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 其代價，無論是要簽訂怎樣的惡魔契約都無所謂。{n}為此，就算是要獻上剩下的全部人生也無所謂…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 其代价，无论是要签订怎样的恶魔契约都无所谓。{n}为此，就算是要献上剩下的全部人生也无所谓…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In cambio, potrebbe impormi qualsiasi tipo di contratto diabolico. Per questo scopo, sacrificherei tutto ciò che resta della mia vita...

Steam (ST): George probably couldn't believe or realize that his voiceless wish... was heard by the witch herself, who stood right behind him.
Umineko Project (UP): George probably couldn't have believed or noticed that, ...right behind him, ......the witch herself stood, listening to his voiceless wish.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): George probably couldn't believe or notice that his voiceless wish, ...was heard by the witch herself, standing right behind him.
PC Japanese (JP): その譲治の、…声無き願いを、……彼のすぐ後で、…その当人の魔女が聞いていたなんて、彼には信じることも気付くこともできないだろう。
Russian (RU): Джордж, наверное, не мог поверить или догадаться, что его немое желание... Оказалось услышано самой ведьмой, стоящей прямо за его спиной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): George provavelmente não podia ter acreditado ou percebido que, ...bem atrás dele, ......a própria bruxa estava ali parada, ouvindo o desejo sem voz dele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讓治是根本不會相信，…也不會注意到，……自己那無聲的祈願，…已全被在他身後的魔女本人聽到了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 让治是根本不会相信，…也不会注意到，……自己那无声的祈愿，…已全被在他身后的魔女本人听到了吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Probabilmente George non avrebbe potuto credere o accorgersi che il suo desiderio silenzioso... era stato ascoltato proprio dalla strega, che si trovava dietro di lui.

Steam (ST): {f:5:Beatrice} had been listening to that entire discussion between the children just now in the cousins' room.
Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Beatrice} had been listening to everything George and the others had to say since their discussion just now in the cousins' room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beatrice had been listening to the children's discussion just now in the cousins' room the whole time.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトリーチェは、譲治たちの話を、さっきのいとこ部屋からずっと聞いていたのだ。
Russian (RU): Всё это время {f:5:Беатриче} слушала обсуждения детей в комнате кузенов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Beatrice} estava ouvindo tudo que George e os outros tinham a dizer desde sua discussão ainda há pouco no quarto dos primos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 自剛才在堂兄妹房間時起，貝阿朵莉切就一直在聽讓治他們談的那些話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 自刚才在堂兄妹房间时起，贝阿朵莉切就一直在听让治他们谈的那些话。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Beatrice aveva ascoltato tutta la discussione dei ragazzi poco prima nella stanza dei cugini.

Steam (ST): ...Battler had told her that she didn't know the value of a human's life, ...and wanting to understand that in her own way, she had stealthily visited, listening in on their discussion.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Battler had told her that she didn't know the weight of a human's life, ......and wanting to understand that in her own way, she had stealthily visited, and listened to their discussion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Battler had told her that she didn't know the value of a human's life, ......and wanting to understand that in her own way, she had stealthily visited, and listened to their discussion.
PC Japanese (JP): ……戦人に、人の命の重みを知らないと言われ、……彼女なりにそれを理解したくて、こっそりとここへ訪れ、彼らの話に耳を傾けていたのだ。
Russian (RU): ......Баттлер сказал ей, что она не понимает, насколько ценна человеческая жизнь. И желая самостоятельно узнать об этом, она тайком посетила домик для гостей и слушала их беседы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Battler tinha lhe dito que ela não sabia o peso da vida de um humano, ......e querendo entender isso de sua própria forma, ela visitou furtivamente, e escutou a discussão deles.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……戰人說過她，不知人命之沉重，……所以她想設法搞懂這點，偷偷地來到了此處，傾聽了他們的對話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……战人说过她，不知人命之沉重，……所以她想设法搞懂这点，偷偷地来到了此处，倾听了他们的对话。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Battler le aveva detto che lei non conosceva il valore della vita di un essere umano... e volendolo comprendere a modo suo, si era intrufolata di nascosto, e aveva ascoltato la loro discussione.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "......... ...That is your wish, you say...? If I could grant that, would I be accepted as a witch...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "........................ ......You say that is your wish...? If I could grant that, would I be accepted as a witch...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "........................That is your wish, you say...? If I could grant that, would I be accepted as a witch...?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……………………。……それが、願いだというのか…？　それを叶えれば、妾は魔女だと、認められるのか…？」
Russian (RU): "........................Значит, таково твоё желание?.. Если я исполню его, буду ли я признана ведьмой?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "........................ ......Está dizendo que esse é seu desejo...? Se eu puder conceder isso, eu seria aceita como uma bruxa...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……………………。……這就是，所謂的祈願嗎…？若將此實現，妾身就能被承認為魔女嗎…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……………………。……这就是，所谓的祈愿吗…？若将此实现，妾身就能被承认为魔女吗…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Questo è il tuo desiderio, dici...? Se potessi realizzarlo, verrei accettata come strega...?"

Steam (ST): Beato looked at the palms of both of her hands.
Umineko Project (UP): Beato looked at the palms of both of her hands.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトは自分の両手の手の平を見る。

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝阿朵望著自己雙手的手掌。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵望着自己双手的手掌。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Beato spostò lo sguardo sui palmi delle sue mani.

Steam (ST): ...She had handed over most of her once-surging magical power when the new witch succeeded the name of the Endless Witch.
Umineko Project (UP): ...She had handed over most of her previously surging magic power when the new witch had succeeded the name of Endless Witch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …かつての迸るような魔力は、無限の魔女の名を新しき魔女に継承した時に、ほとんどを受け渡してしまった。
Russian (RU): ...Она передала большую часть своей могучей магической силы, когда новая ведьма получила титул Ведьмы Бесконечности.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Ela tinha entregue a maior parte do seu potencial mágico quando a nova bruxa tinha herdado o nome da Bruxa do Infinito.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …曾經洶涌澎湃的魔力，已在將無限魔女之名傳予新魔女之時，交付殆盡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …曾经汹涌澎湃的魔力，已在将无限魔女之名传予新魔女之时，交付殆尽。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Aveva dato via gran parte del suo incredibile potere magico quando la nuova strega aveva ottenuto il titolo di Strega dell'Infinito.

Steam (ST): Of course, her current power still made her worthy of being called a witch, ...but it could not begin to compare to her previous strength.
Umineko Project (UP): Of course, even now her magic power still made her worthy of being called a witch, ...but it did not even compare to her previous strength.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, her current magic power still made her worthy of being called a witch, ...but it did not even compare to her previous strength.
PC Japanese (JP): もちろん、今だって魔女の名に相応しい魔力を持ってはいるが、…それはだいぶ見劣るものだった。
Russian (RU): Разумеется, её оставшаяся магическая сила всё ещё позволяла ей гордо называть себя ведьмой, но даже это не шло ни в какое сравнение с её предыдущей силой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, mesmo agora o poder mágico dela ainda a tornava digna de ser chamada de bruxa, ...mas ele nem se comparava à sua força anterior.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Certo, il suo potere attuale la rendeva ancora degna di dirsi una strega... ma non si poteva nemmeno comparare alla forza che aveva posseduto.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...Hmm. Even without the Endless Magic, I am a Great Witch whose name has been thundered for a thousand years. Reviving the dead will be no trouble at all."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Hmph. Even without the Endless Magic, I am a Great Witch whose name has thundered through a thousand years. Reviving the dead is no trouble at all."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Hmm. Even without the Endless Magic, I am a Great Witch whose name has been thundered for a thousand years. Reviving the dead is no trouble at all."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……ふん。無限の魔法などなくとも、妾は千年に名を轟かす大魔女であるぞ。死者を蘇らすなど、造作もないことよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……ふん。無限の魔法などなくとも、妾は千年に名を轟かす大魔女であるぞ。死者を蘇らすなど、造作もないことよ」
Russian (RU): "......Хм‐м. Даже перестав быть Ведьмой Бесконечности, я всё ещё Великая Ведьма, чьё имя гремело в течение тысячи лет. С возрождением мёртвых у меня никогда не было проблем."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Hmph. Mesmo sem a Magia do Infinito, sou uma Grande Bruxa cujo nome trovejou por mil anos. Reviver os mortos não é problema nenhum."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……哼。即便沒有無限之魔法，妾身也是個名震千年的大魔女。復生死者，不過小事一樁。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……哼。即便没有无限之魔法，妾身也是个名震千年的大魔女。复生死者，不过小事一桩。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Hmm. Pur senza la Magia Infinita, sono una Grande Strega il cui nome è risuonato come tuono per mille anni. Resuscitare i defunti non è affatto difficile."

Steam (ST): Inside her head, she thought about several magical steps she could take to revive the dead.
Umineko Project (UP): Inside her head, she thought about several magical methods for reviving the dead.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Inside her head, she thought about several magical steps she could take to revive the dead.
PC Japanese (JP): 頭の中で、死者を蘇らすいくつかの魔法的手段を思案する。
Russian (RU): В своей голове она продумывала несколько магических ходов, при помощи которых могла бы оживить мёртвых.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dentro de sua cabeça, ela pensou em diversos métodos mágicos para reviver os mortos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她的腦中思量起了好幾種復生死者的魔法方法。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她的脑中思量起了好几种复生死者的魔法方法。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nella sua mente, considerò diversi metodi magici che avrebbe potuto utilizzare per riportare in vita i morti.

Steam (ST): ...Even magic that should have been easy in the past would be difficult with her current power.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Even magic that she could do easily in the past would be difficult with her current magic power.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Even magic that should have been easy in the past would be difficult with her current magic power.
PC Japanese (JP): ……かつては容易に出来たはずの魔法も、今の魔力では難しくなっている。
Russian (RU): ......Даже магия, раньше с лёгкостью удававшаяся ей, теперь вызывала трудности с её текущим уровнем магической силы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Até magias que ela conseguia fazer facilmente no passado seriam difíceis com seu poder mágico atual.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……然而，曾經能輕易使出的魔法，以現今的魔力就難以做到了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……然而，曾经能轻易使出的魔法，以现今的魔力就难以做到了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Anche magie che in passato erano state semplici sarebbero state complicate col potere di cui disponeva adesso.

Steam (ST): She thought of something, then clicked her tongue, then did so again, over and over.
Umineko Project (UP): She thought of something, then clicked her tongue, and repeated this several times.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She thought of something, then clicked her tongue, and repeated this several times.
PC Japanese (JP): 思いついては舌を打つ、を数度繰り返す。
Russian (RU): Она что‐то задумала, затем щёлкнула языком и повторила это несколько раз.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela pensava em algo, então estalava sua língua, e repetia isto diversas vezes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這也行不通那也行不通，連著咂了好幾次嘴。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这也行不通那也行不通，连着咂了好几次嘴。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ebbe un'idea, poi schioccò la lingua, e ripeté queste azioni svariate volte.

Steam (ST): In the end, ...she finally thought of a single spell.
Umineko Project (UP): In the end, ......she finally thought of a single spell.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the end, ......she finally thought of a single magic.
PC Japanese (JP): その末、……ようやく、ひとつの魔法を思いつく。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por fim, ......ela finalmente pensou em um único feitiço.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在最後，……總算是想到了一個魔法。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在最后，……总算是想到了一个魔法。

Steam (ST): But that was a spell that she couldn't use by herself. It was a spell that witches with weak power used, one that relied on the aid of others.
Umineko Project (UP): But that was a spell that she couldn't use by herself.{n}It was a spell that witches with weak power used, that relied on the aid of others.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But that was a magic that she couldn't use by herself. It was a magic that witches with weak power used, that relied on the aid of others.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしそれは、彼女ひとりでは使えない魔法。力の弱い魔女が使う、他者の助けを借りる魔法だ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかしそれは、彼女ひとりでは使えない魔法。{n}力の弱い魔女が使う、他者の助けを借りる魔法だ。
Russian (RU): Но это была магия, использовать которую одной ей было не под силу.{n}То была магия, которую ведьмы с ограниченной магической силой могли использовать лишь прибегая к помощи других.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas esse era um feitiço que ela não conseguia usar por conta própria.{n}Era um feitiço que bruxas com poder fraco usavam, que confiava no auxílio de outros.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，这是个无法由她独自使出的魔法。{n}这是弱小的魔女使用的，需要借助他人帮助的魔法
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma si trattava di una magia che non poteva esercitare da sola. Era una magia che veniva usata da streghe poco potenti, che si affidava all'aiuto altrui.

Steam (ST): ...In the past, Beato had looked down upon that type of magic.
Umineko Project (UP): ...In the past, Beato had looked down upon that type of magic.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …かつて、ベアトはそういう類の魔法を見下していた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...No passado, Beato tinha menosprezado esse tipo de magia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …貝阿朵以前很藐視此類魔法。

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... In passato, Beato aveva disdegnato quel tipo di magia.

Steam (ST): Therefore, she frantically tried to search for any conceivable alternative, ......but in the end, she couldn't think of one and slumped over in self-derision.
Umineko Project (UP): Therefore, she frantically tried to think if there wasn't any other possible spell, .........but in the end, she couldn't think of one, and slumped over in self‐derision.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Therefore, she frantically tried to think if there wasn't any other possible magic, .........but in the end, she couldn't think of one, and slumped over in self-derision.
PC Japanese (JP): なので、それ以外に可能な魔法はないのかと、必死に思案してみたのだが、………結局、思いつかず、肩を落として自嘲する。
Russian (RU): По этой причине она отчаянно пыталась вспомнить, не остаётся ли ещё возможных видов магии, но в конце концов, так и не сумев вспомнить, она усмехнулась над собой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Logo, ela tentou freneticamente pensar se não havia qualquer outro feitiço possível, .........mas, no fim, ela não conseguiu lembrar de nenhum, e caiu em autoescárnio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，她剛才在拚命思索著，有沒有除此以外的可行的魔法，………但結果，她一個都想不出來，只好垂下肩膀聊以自嘲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，她刚才在拼命思索着，有没有除此以外的可行的魔法，………但结果，她一个都想不出来，只好垂下肩膀聊以自嘲。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perciò, cercò freneticamente di ricordare se non vi ne fosse un altro incantesimo... ma alla fine, non riuscì a trovarne nemmeno uno, e crollò a terrà colma deridendo se stessa.

Steam (ST): Then, ...careful not to surprise him, she softly called out. Softly, to George's heart...
Umineko Project (UP): And then, ......careful not to surprise him, she softly called out. Softly, to George's heart...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And then, ......careful not to surprise him, she softly called out. Softly, to George's heart...
PC Japanese (JP): そして、……なるべく驚かさないように、そっと声を掛けた。譲治の心に、そっと…。
Russian (RU): И затем, осторожно, чтобы не шокировать его, она негромко обратилась к нему. Мягко, к самому сердцу Джорджа...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E então, ......tomando cuidado para não surpreendê‐lo, ela chamou suavemente. Suavemente, ao coração de George...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，……為了盡量不嚇到他，貝阿朵悄悄地向讓治的心，送去了輕輕的一句話…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，……为了尽量不吓到他，贝阿朵悄悄地向让治的心，送去了轻轻的一句话…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E poi... facendo attenzione a non spaventarlo, chiamò con dolcezza. {n}Con dolcezza, chiamò il cuore di George...

Umineko Project (UP): ".........Ushiromiya George. ...Can you hear my voice...?"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Ushiromiya George. ...Consegue ouvir a minha voz...?"

Umineko Project (UP): "......I can hear. ......Who are you...? Are you really the witch, {f:5:Beatrice}...? ...Or else, are you an illusion created by my sadness...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I can hear. ......Who are you...? Are you really the witch, Beatrice...? ...Or else, are you an illusion created by my sadness...?
PC Japanese (JP): 「……聞こえるとも。……あなたは誰だい…？　本当に魔女のベアトリーチェ…？　…それとも、僕の悲しみが生んだ幻想なのか…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……聞こえるとも。……あなたは誰だい…？　本当に魔女のベアトリーチェ…？　…それとも、僕の悲しみが生んだ幻想なのか…」
Russian (RU): "......Я слышу его. ......Кто ты?.. Ты и вправду ведьма, {f:5:Беатриче}?.. ...Или же ты лишь иллюзия, рождённая моей печалью?.."

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Posso sentirti. ... Chi sei...? Sei veramente la strega, Beatrice...? Oppure, sei un'illusione creata dalla mia tristezza...?

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "......If it's the former, please hear my wish. ...And if it's the latter, just leave me alone..."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........If it's the former, I want you to hear my wish. ...And if it's the latter, just leave me alone..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........If it's the former, I want you to hear my wish. ...And if it's the latter, just leave me alone..."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………もしも前者だったなら、僕の願いを聞いて欲しい。…そして後者なら、僕をそっとしておいてほしい…」
Russian (RU): ".........Если первое, я хотел бы, чтобы ты услышала моё желание. ...А если последнее, просто оставь меня одного..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Se for a primeira opção, quero que você escute meu desejo. ...E se for a última, apenas me deixe sozinho..."

Steam (ST): Their conversation in a mental world was a lot like having one in a dream.
Umineko Project (UP): Conversations in the world of the mind are a lot like those in a dream.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Their conversation in a mental world was a lot like having one in a dream.

Russian (RU): Их разговор в неосязаемом мире напоминал сон.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Conversas no mundo da mente são similares às de um sonho.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 在精神世界中的对话，十分类似于梦中的情景。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La loro conversazione nel piano mentale era molto simile ad una conversazione avuta in sogno.

Steam (ST): When you dream, haven't you ever had the experience... of casually accepting something that would've been absurd in the real world?
Umineko Project (UP): When you dream, haven't you ever had the experience...of casually accepting something that would have been absurd in the real world?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When you dream, haven't you ever had the experience... of casually accepting something that would have been absurd in the real world?

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando sonha, você já teve a experiência...de casualmente aceitar algo que teria sido absurdo no mundo real?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 人人都有過，在現實中出現時就是荒謬無稽的情景，在做夢時卻能理所當然地接受，這樣的經歷吧？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 人人都有过，在现实中出现时就是荒谬无稽的情景，在做梦时却能理所当然地接受，这样的经历吧？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sognando, non vi è mai accaduto... di accettare senza problemi qualcosa che nel mondo reale sarebbe stata assurda?

Umineko Project (UP): ......The conversation in this world was like that.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A conversa neste mundo era assim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……在這個世界中的對話，就類似於此。

Steam (ST): So even though a witch appeared and started talking to George, he was not surprised...
Umineko Project (UP): So even though a witch appeared and started talking to George, he was not surprised...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So even though a witch appeared and started talking to George, he was not surprised...

Russian (RU): "......Помолчи. Я сейчас очень ослаблена. Приди сюда ещё {y:0:Люд}{n:0:люд}и, и я не смогу удержать эту форму. ...Я исполню твою просьбу, поэтому сейчас помолчи. ...Тебя это устраивает?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Fique quieto. Estou muito frágil agora. Se mais {y:0:Humanos}{n:0:humanos} aparecerem agora, não serei capaz de preservar esta forma. ...Devo conceder seu desejo, então fique em silêncio por ora. ...Está bem assim?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……安靜點。現在的妾身非常脆弱。若是再出現其他人類的話，就無法保住身形了。…妾身會實現汝的心願，此刻先保持沉默。…好嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……安静点。现在的妾身非常脆弱。若是再出现其他人类的话，就无法保住身形了。…妾身会实现汝的心愿，此刻先保持沉默。…好吗？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Fa' silenzio. Ora come ora sono molto fragile. Se dovessero comparire altri umani in questo istante, non sarò in grado di mantenere questo aspetto. ... Esaudirò il tuo desiderio, perciò resta in silenzio. ... D'accordo?"

Steam (ST): George covered his mouth with both hands, nodding enthusiastically several times.
Umineko Project (UP): George covered his mouth with both hands, forcefully nodding several times.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治は自らの口を両手で押さえ、何度も力強く頷いた。
Russian (RU): Джордж прикрыв рот обеими руками, энергично кивнул несколько раз.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): George cobriu sua boca com ambas as mãos, assentindo com vigor diversas vezes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讓治用雙手按住了自己的嘴巴，不停地重重點頭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 让治用双手按住了自己的嘴巴，不停地重重点头。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): George si coprì la bocca con ambo le mani, annuendo energeticamente diverse volte.

Steam (ST): In that instant, he almost dropped the mug he was holding.
Umineko Project (UP): As he did, he almost dropped the mug he was holding.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In that instant, it looked as though the mug he was holding was about to fall.
PC Japanese (JP): その拍子に、手に持っていたマグカップを落としそうになる。
Russian (RU): В этот момент показалось, что он вот‐вот уронит державшую в руках кружку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto ele o fazia, quase derrubou a caneca que estava segurando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這動作差點使他脫手摔下手中的馬克杯。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这动作差点使他脱手摔下手中的马克杯。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In quel frangente, parve che la tazza che aveva in mano stesse per cadere.

Steam (ST): George frantically juggled it around and caught it.
Umineko Project (UP): George frantically juggled it around and caught it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): George frantically juggled it around and caught it.
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治は慌ててそれをお手玉しながらキャッチする。
Russian (RU): Джордж отчаянно жонглируя ей, всё же смог её поймать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...George manipulou‐a freneticamente e a capturou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讓治慌張地如耍雜技般抓住了杯子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 让治慌张地如耍杂技般抓住了杯子。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Freneticamente, George la passò da una mano all'altra e riuscì ad afferrarla.

Steam (ST): ...He was afraid that if it fell to the floor and made a loud sound, the witch's form might disappear like a bubble popping.
Umineko Project (UP): ...He was afraid that if it fell to the floor and made a loud sound, the witch's form might disappear like a bubble popping.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …もし、それを床に落として大きな音を立てたなら、シャボン玉が弾けるように魔女の姿も消えてしまうかもしれないと恐れたのだ。
Russian (RU): ...Он боялся, что стоим ему уронить её на пол и поднять шум, форма ведьмы тут же исчезнет словно лопнувший мыльный пузырь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Ele estava com medo que se ela caísse no chão e fizesse um som alto, a forma da bruxa poderia desaparecer como uma bolha estourando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …這是因為，他怕要是這杯子掉到地板上，發出很大聲響的話，魔女就有可能會如爆裂的肥皂泡般消失無踪。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …这是因为，他怕要是这杯子掉到地板上，发出很大声响的话，魔女就有可能会如爆裂的肥皂泡般消失无踪。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Aveva paura che se fosse caduta sul pavimento e avesse fatto rumore, la figura della strega si sarebbe potuta dileguare come una bolla che scoppia.

Steam (ST): He softly set the mug on the floor...and stared at the witch in front of him again.
Umineko Project (UP): He softly set the mug on the floor, ...and stared once again at the witch in front of him.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He softly set the mug on the floor, ...and stared at the witch in front of him again.
PC Japanese (JP): 床にそっとマグカップを置き、…正面の魔女をもう一度凝視する。
Russian (RU): Он мягко поставил кружку на пол и снова направил взгляд на ведьму, стоявшую перед ним.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele colocou a caneca no piso suavemente, ...encarando mais uma vez a bruxa diante dele.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 让治轻轻地将马克杯放到地板上，…再一次凝视起了面前的魔女。

Steam (ST): ......Her form didn't disappear. It wasn't a dream...
Umineko Project (UP): .........Her form didn't disappear. It wasn't a dream......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ………姿は消えない。夢ではないのだ……。
Russian (RU): .........Её форма не исчезла. Это не было видением...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........A forma dela não desapareceu. Isso não era um sonho......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………沒有消失。不是夢……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………没有消失。不是梦……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... La sua figura non svanì. Non era un sogno...

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Come, let us go to the parlor where Shannon sleeps. With the power of your feelings, we will bring back her soul."
Umineko Project (UP): "Come, let us go to the parlor where Shannon sleeps. With the power of your feelings, we will bring back her soul."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「さぁ、紗音が眠る客室へ行くぞ。そなたの想いの力にて、彼女の魂を連れ戻すのだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「さぁ、紗音が眠る客室へ行くぞ。そなたの想いの力にて、彼女の魂を連れ戻すのだ」
Russian (RU): "Вперёд, мы должны отправиться в гостиную, где спит Шаннон. С силой твоих чувств мы вернём её душу."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Venha, vamos para a sala onde Shannon dorme. Com o poder de seus sentimentos, traremos de volta a alma dela."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「來，動身去紗音沉眠著的客廳。以汝的思念之力，帶回她的靈魂。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「来，动身去纱音沉眠着的客厅。以汝的思念之力，带回她的灵魂。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Su, rechiamoci nel salotto dove riposa Shannon. Con la forza dei tuoi sentimenti, riporteremo indietro la sua anima."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "Y-You say go, but how...? My mother and the rest are downstairs. There's no way they'd let us go outside. ...And...didn't you just say that you wouldn't be able to preserve your form if another Human appeared?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Y‐you say go, but...how...? My mother and the others are downstairs. There's no way they'd let me go outside. ......And, didn't you just say that you wouldn't be able to preserve your form if another {y:0:Human}{n:0:human} appeared?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Y, you say go, but how...? My mother and the rest are downstairs. There's no way they'd let us go outside. ......And, didn't you just say that you wouldn't be able to preserve your form if another human appeared?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「い、行くって、どうやって…。下には母さんたちがいる。表へ出るのを許してくれるわけがない。……それに、あなたはさっき、他のニンゲンが現れたら姿を保てないと言わなかったかい？」
Russian (RU): "Х‐хоть ты и говоришь пойти, но как?.. Моя мать и остальные внизу. Они ни под каким предлогом не выпустят меня наружу. ......И разве ты не говорила, что ты не сможешь удержать свою форму, если появится больше {y:0:Люд}{n:0:люд}ей?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "V‐Você diz que vamos, mas...como...? Minha mãe e os outros estão lá embaixo. Não tem como eles me deixarem sair. ......E você não acabou de dizer que não seria capaz de preservar sua forma se outro {y:0:Humano}{n:0:humano} aparecesse?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「動、動身，是要怎麼去…？樓下有媽媽與長輩們。他們是不可能允許我到外面去的。……再者，你剛才不也說了，若是出現其他人類，就沒法保住身形了嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「动、动身，是要怎么去…？楼下有妈妈与长辈们。他们是不可能允许我到外面去的。……再者，你刚才不也说了，若是出现其他人类，就没法保住身形了吗？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "D-Dici di andare, ma in che modo...? Mia Madre e gli altri sono giù. Non ci lascerebbero mai uscire. ... Inoltre, non hai appena detto che non saresti in grado di mantenere il tuo aspetto se apparisse un altro essere umano?"

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...Come to think of it, that is true. So, Krauss and the rest are downstairs. ...In that case, we definitely cannot go down. ...Well then, we just need to go to the mansion without going down to the first floor, right? It's simple."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Come to think of it, that is true. So, Krauss and the rest are downstairs. ...In that case, we definitely cannot go down. ......Well then, we just need to go to the mansion without going downstairs, right? It's simple."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Come to think of it, that is true. So, Krauss and the rest are downstairs. ...In that case, we definitely cannot go down. ......Well then, we just need to go to the mansion without going down to the first floor, right? It's simple."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……そう言えばそうだったな。下には蔵臼たちがおったか。…それでは確かに下へ降りられぬな。……ならば、１階へ降りずに、屋敷へ行けばいいではないか。簡単な話よ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……そう言えばそうだったな。下には蔵臼たちがおったか。…それでは確かに下へ降りられぬな。……ならば、１階へ降りずに、屋敷へ行けばいいではないか。簡単な話よ」
Russian (RU): "......А ведь и правда. Итак, Краусс и остальные находятся внизу. ...В таком случае мы определённо не можем спуститься вниз. ......Что ж, мы просто должны попасть в особняк, минуя первый этаж, верно? Это не проблема."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Pensando bem, é verdade. Então, Krauss e os demais estão lá embaixo? ...Nesse caso, definitivamente não podemos descer. ......Bem, então só precisamos ir à mansão sem descer as escadas, certo? É simples."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……說來倒確實如此呢。樓下有著藏臼等人麼。…這倒確實是不能下樓了呢。……那麼，便不下一樓地前去大屋，不就行了？很簡單的事嘛。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……说来倒确实如此呢。楼下有着藏臼等人么。…这倒确实是不能下楼了呢。……那么，便不下一楼地前去大屋，不就行了？很简单的事嘛。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... A pensarci, è vero. Dunque, Krauss e gli altri sono disotto. ... In tal caso, non possiamo proprio scendere. ... Bene allora, dobbiamo solo arrivare alla villa senza scendere al piano terra, giusto? È semplice."

Steam (ST): Beato laughed, as though she had thought of a pleasant prank.
Umineko Project (UP): Beato laughed, as though she had thought of a pleasant prank.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): まるで、愉快な悪戯でも思いついたかのようにベアトは笑う。
Russian (RU): Беато рассмеялась, словно ей на ум пришла весёлая шалость.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Beato riu, como se tivesse pensado em uma brincadeira agradável.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 简直就像是想到了一个好玩的恶作剧似的，贝阿朵笑了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Beato rise, come se avesse escogitato uno scherzo divertente.

Steam (ST): ...And with her golden pipe, she lightly tapped a window with its shutter closed.
Umineko Project (UP): ......And with her golden pipe, she lightly tapped a window with its shutter closed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……そして黄金の煙管で、鎧戸が閉ざす窓を軽く叩いた。
Russian (RU): ......И своей золотой трубкой она слегка постучала в окно с запертой ставней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E com seu cachimbo dourado, ela bateu levemente em uma janela com sua veneziana fechada.

Steam (ST): When she did, three gold butterflies appeared from the pipe and opened the lock on the window as though melting it.
Umineko Project (UP): When she did, three gold butterflies appeared from the pipe and opened the lock on the window as though melting it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When she did, three gold butterflies appeared from the pipe and opened the lock on the window as though melting it.
PC Japanese (JP): すると、煙管から３匹の黄金の蝶が現れ、窓の鍵を、溶かすように開けてしまう。
Russian (RU): Стоило ей это сделать, и три золотых бабочки вылетели из трубки и раскрыли замок на окне, словно его оплавили.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao fazer isso, três borboletas douradas apareceram saindo do cachimbo e abriram a tranca na janela, como que derretendo‐a.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，从烟管中冒出了三只黄金蝶，如将之熔化般地，打开了窗户的锁。

Steam (ST): Then, the window opened without a sound.
Umineko Project (UP): Then the window opened without a sound.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then the window opened without a sound.
PC Japanese (JP): そして音もなく窓をすうっと開いた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então a janela abriu sem fazer som algum.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，窗戶無聲地悄悄敞開。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，窗户无声地悄悄敞开。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Poi la finestra si aprì senza alcun rumore.

Steam (ST): The shutter beyond it was exactly the same. The clasp unset itself, also without making a sound, and it quietly opened.
Umineko Project (UP): The shutter beyond it was exactly the same.{n}The clasp unset itself, also without making a sound, and it quietly opened.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The shutter beyond it was exactly the same. The clasp unset itself, also without making a sound, and it quietly opened.
PC Japanese (JP): その向こうの鎧戸もまったく同じ。留め金が、同じく音もなく外れて、すぅっと静かに開いた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その向こうの鎧戸もまったく同じ。{n}留め金が、同じく音もなく外れて、すぅっと静かに開いた。
Russian (RU): Затвор на его наружной части был таким же.{n}Защёлка беззвучно открепилась и тихо открылась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com a veneziana além dela foi exatamente igual.{n}O fecho se desfez, também sem fazer som, e ela abriu silenciosamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 外面的百葉窗也完全一樣。{n}同樣無聲地松開鎖扣，靜靜開啟。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 外面的百叶窗也完全一样。{n}同样无声地松开锁扣，静静开启。

Steam (ST): The window opened, exposing the wind and rain outside the mansion. ...Perhaps because of the direction or something related to the construction of the building, the wind did not blow inside.
Umineko Project (UP): The window opened, exposing the wind and rain outside the mansion. ...Perhaps because of the direction or something related to the construction of the building, the wind did not blow inside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The window opened, exposing the wind and rain outside the mansion....Perhaps because of the direction or something related to the construction of the building, the wind did not blow inside.
PC Japanese (JP): 窓が開き、風雨の屋外が晒される。…そこは向きや建物の構造上の関係なのか、風が吹き込まなかった。
Russian (RU): Окно растворилось, явив взору дождь и ветер снаружи особняка. ...Возможно, из‐за направления или самой конструкции здания, ветер не задувал внутрь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A janela aberta expunha o vento e a chuva fora da mansão. ...Talvez por causa da direção ou algo relacionado à construção do prédio, o vento não soprava para dentro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 窗戶打開後，顯露出了風雨交加的屋外。…是出於朝向或建築物構造上的原因吧，風吹不進此處。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 窗户打开后，显露出了风雨交加的屋外。…是出于朝向或建筑物构造上的原因吧，风吹不进此处。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La finestra si aprì, rivelando il vento e la pioggia fuori alla villa. ... Forse a causa della sua direzione o per qualche caratteristica della costruzione dell'edificio, il vento non soffiò all'interno.

Steam (ST): Because of that, for a while, George felt as though this entrance that opened to the outside was a dream or an illusion, and he couldn't accept it as real.
Umineko Project (UP): Because of that, for a while, George felt as though this entrance opening to the outside was a dream or illusion, and he couldn't accept it as real.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because of that, for a while, George felt as though this entrance opening to the outside was a dream or illusion, and he couldn't accept it as real.
PC Japanese (JP): そのせいで譲治は、しばらくの間、外への入り口が開かれたことを夢か幻のように感じてしまい、実感することができなかった。
Russian (RU): Поэтому Джорджу на какое‐то время почудилось, будто этот выход наружу был лишь сном или иллюзией, и он не мог поверить в его реальность.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por causa disso, por um momento, George sentiu como se esta entrada se abrindo para o exterior era um sonho ou ilusão, e não conseguiu aceitá‐la como real.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此讓治有好一會兒，都感覺打開通往外界的入口一事就像是一場夢，沒有一絲真實感。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此让治有好一会儿，都感觉打开通往外界的入口一事就像是一场梦，没有一丝真实感。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per questo motivo, per qualche istante, George si sentì come se questo portale verso l'esterno fosse un sogno o un'illusione, e non riusciva ad accettare che fosse reale.

Umineko Project (UP): "Come, let us go. Come with me."

Steam (ST): Beato gently floated upwards. It was a natural action, like that of a diver enjoying an underwater stroll.
Umineko Project (UP): Beato gently floated upwards. It was a natural action, like that of a diver enjoying an underwater stroll.

Russian (RU): Беато мягко взмыла вверх. Это было естественное действие, словно его совершал водолаз, наслаждающийся водной прогулкой.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): At that time, the witch noticed something.......As though some presence had disappeared......was it her imagination......?
PC Japanese (JP): その時、魔女は何かに気付く。……何かの気配が去っていったかのような、……気のせい……？
Russian (RU): В этот момент ведьма что‐то почуяла. ......Как если бы пропало чьё то присутствие... Почудилось ли ей?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquela hora, a bruxa notou algo. ......Como se alguma presença tivesse desaparecido... ...Foi a imaginação dela......?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此時，魔女察覺到了什麼。……好像是有什麼人在漸漸遠去，……多心了……？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此时，魔女察觉到了什么。……好像是有什么人在渐渐远去，……多心了……？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In quel frangente, la strega notò qualcosa. ... Come se una presenza fosse appena scomparsa... che fosse la sua immaginazione...?

Speaker: {f:5:Eva Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "......Was that someone's presence just now? Did anyone feel it?"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Did you feel some kind of presence just now? Did any of you feel it?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Did you feel some kind of presence just now? Did anyone feel it?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………今、何か気配を感じなかった？　誰か感じた人いる？」
Russian (RU): ".........Прямо сейчас, вы ничего не почувствовали? Было ощущение человеческого присутствия?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Vocês sentiram algum tipo de presença ainda pouco? Algum de vocês a sentiu?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………剛才，有沒有感覺到什麼動靜？有沒有感覺到的人？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………刚才，有没有感觉到什么动静？有没有感觉到的人？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Avete avvertito qualche sorta di presenza, in questo momento? Nessuno l'ha sentita?"

Speaker: Chiester45
Steam (ST): "M-My apologies, I haven't noticed anything, ...so please forgive me...!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "M‐...my apologies, I didn't notice anything... Please forgive me......!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "M, ...my apologies, I haven't noticed anything..., please forgive me......!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「もッ、…申し訳ありません、私は何も気付きませんでした…、お許しを……！！」
Russian (RU): "П...простите меня, я ничего не заметила... умоляю, простите меня!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "M‐Minhas desculpas, não notei nada... Por favor, me perdoe......!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「非、…非常抱歉，我沒有發覺任何動靜…，請原諒……！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「非、…非常抱歉，我没有发觉任何动静…，请原谅……！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "L... Le mie scusa, ma non ho notato nulla... la prego mi perdoni...!!"

Speaker: Chiester410
Steam (ST): "We were in the middle of observing the guesthouse, so our peripheral surveillance was set to off. Nihi. ...What about you, Lucifer-chaaan? Did you feel any presence?"
Umineko Project (UP): "We were in the middle of observing the guesthouse, so our peripheral surveillance was turned off. Nihi. ...What about you, Lucifer‐chaaan? Did you feel a presence?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "We were in the middle of observing the guesthouse, so our peripheral surveillance was set to off. Nihi. ...What about you, Lucifer-chaaan? Did you feel a presence?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「私たち、ゲストハウスを観測中でしたから、周辺監視はオフにしてます。にひ。…ルシファーちゃんはぁ？　何か気配感じた？」
Russian (RU): "Мы находились в процессе наблюдения за домиком для гостей, поэтому наблюдение на периферии было отключено. Нихи. ...Как насчёт тебя, Люцифер‐ча‐а‐ан? Ты кого‐нибудь почувствовала?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Estávamos no meio da observação da casa de hóspedes, então nossa vigilância periférica estava desligada. Nihi. ...E quanto a você, Lucifer‐chaaan? Sentiu alguma presença?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我們由於正在觀測賓館，所以關掉了周邊監視。泥嘻。…路西法呢？有沒有感覺到什麼動靜呀？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我们由于正在观测宾馆，所以关掉了周边监视。泥嘻。…路西法呢？有没有感觉到什么动静呀？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Eravamo impegnate ad osservare la casa degli ospiti, perciò la sorveglianza secondaria non era in funzione. Nihi. ... E tu, Lucifer-chaaan? Hai avvertito una presenza?"

Speaker: Lucifer
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Steam (ST): For just an instant, Lucifer glanced at Ronove, asking whether she should answer honestly or not.
Umineko Project (UP): For just an instant, Lucifer sent a glance at Ronove, questioning whether she should answer honestly or not.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For just an instant, Lucifer sent a glance at Ronove, asking whether she should answer honestly or not.
PC Japanese (JP): ルシファーは一瞬だけ目線をロノウェに送り、正直に答えるべきかどうかを問う。
Russian (RU): Люцифер на мгновение бросила взгляд на Ронове, словно спрашивая, отвечать ей честно или нет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Só por um instante, Lucifer deu um olhar de relance para Ronove, questionando se ela devia responder honestamente ou não.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 路西法偷瞄了一眼羅諾威，詢問該不該老實回答。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 路西法偷瞄了一眼罗诺威，询问该不该老实回答。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per un brevissimo istante, Lucifer lanciò uno sguardo a Ronove, chiedendo se dovesse rispondere con sincerità o meno.

Steam (ST): Ronove gave a small nod in response.
Umineko Project (UP): Ronove gave a small nod in response.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ronove gave a small nod in response.
PC Japanese (JP): それにロノウェは、小さく頷いて応えた。
Russian (RU): Ронове слегка кивнул в ответ.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ronove deu um pequeno assentimento em resposta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對此，羅諾威微微點了點頭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对此，罗诺威微微点了点头。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ronove rispose inclinando appena la testa in un cenno d'assenso.

Speaker: Ronove
Steam (ST): "No. ...My apologies, {f:5:Beatrice}-sama. We noticed nothing. ......Forgive us the stupidity of us second-hand furniture."
Umineko Project (UP): "No. ...My apologies, {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama. Nothing from us. .........Forgive us for this stupidity, as we are only second‐hand furniture."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "No. ...My apologies, Beatrice-sama. Nothing from us. .........Forgive us for this stupidity, as we are only second-hand furniture."
PC Japanese (JP): 「いいえ。…申し訳ございません、ベアトリーチェさま。私たちは何も。………中古家具ゆえ、愚鈍なことをお許しください。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「いいえ。…申し訳ございません、ベアトリーチェさま。私たちは何も。………中古家具ゆえ、愚鈍なことをお許しください」
Russian (RU): "Нет. ...Приношу свои извинения, {f:5:Беатриче}‐сама. Мы ничего не заметили. .........Простите нас за эту неосмотрительность, мы всего лишь подержанная второсортная мебель."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não. ...Minhas desculpas, {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama. Nós não percebemos nada. .........Perdoe‐nos por esta estupidez, afinal não passamos de mobílias de {nobr:segunda‐mão}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「沒有。…非常抱歉，貝阿朵莉切夫人。我們什麼都沒有感覺到。………因為是舊家具，所以很是愚鈍，還請原諒。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「没有。…非常抱歉，贝阿朵莉切夫人。我们什么都没有感觉到。………因为是旧家具，所以很是愚钝，还请原谅。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "No. ... Le mie scuse, Beatrice-sama. Non abbiamo percepito niente. {n}Ci perdoni per questa imperizia, in fondo non siamo altro che mobili di seconda mano."

Speaker: {f:5:Eva Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "............ ...I see. If a great demon like you says that, then it must've been my imagination."
Umineko Project (UP): "........................... ......I see. If a Great Demon like you says that, then it must have been my imagination."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "..............................I see. If a great demon like you says that, then it must have been my imagination."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………………………。……そう。大悪魔のあなたがそう言うなら、きっと私の気のせいなんでしょうね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………………………。……そう。大悪魔のあなたがそう言うなら、きっと私の気のせいなんでしょうね」
Russian (RU): "..............................Вот как. Если это говорит такой великий демон, как ты, значит это лишь моё воображение."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "........................... ......Entendo. Se um Grande Demônio como você diz isso, então deve ter sido minha imaginação."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………………………。……這樣啊。既然身為大惡魔的你都這麼說了，那這就一定是我多心了吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………………………。……这样啊。既然身为大恶魔的你都这么说了，那这就一定是我多心了吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Capisco. Se un gran demone come te dice di non aver percepito niente, devo essermelo immaginato."

Steam (ST): The witch persistently stared in the direction the presence had disappeared to.
Umineko Project (UP): The witch stared persistently in the direction the presence had disappeared to.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The witch persistently stared in the direction the presence had disappeared to.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女は、気配の消え去った方角を執念深く凝視する。
Russian (RU): Ведьма настойчиво смотрела в сторону, где пропало присутствие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A bruxa encarou persistentemente na direção em que a presença tinha desaparecido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女甚是執著地凝視起了，方才感覺有人遠去消失的方向。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女甚是执着地凝视起了，方才感觉有人远去消失的方向。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La strega fissò con insistenza la direzione in cui la presenza era svanita.

Steam (ST): ...That was where the rose garden lay. And beyond that, she could see the mansion's dark silhouette creating by lightning.
Umineko Project (UP): ......That was the direction of the rose garden. And beyond that, she could see the mansion's dark silhouette created by lightning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......That was the direction of the rose garden. And beyond that, she could see the mansion's dark silhouette creating by lightning.
PC Japanese (JP): ……それは薔薇庭園の方角。そしてその向こうには、雷光に黒いシルエットを浮かび上がらせる屋敷が見える。
Russian (RU): ......В этой стороне находился розарий. И в этом направлении она видела темный силуэт особняка, созданный молнией.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Aquela era a direção do jardim de rosas. E além desse ponto, ela podia ver a silhueta escura da mansão, criada pelo relâmpago.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……那是玫瑰庭園的方向。在庭園的另一邊，可以看到被雷光照成黑色剪影的大屋。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……那是玫瑰庭园的方向。在庭园的另一边，可以看到被雷光照成黑色剪影的大屋。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Era la direzione in cui si trovava il roseto. E dietro di esso, poteva scorgere la sagoma scura della villa creata dai fulmini.

Steam (ST): ...It took quite some time before she pushed her unsatisfied feelings aside... and once again faced the guesthouse.
Umineko Project (UP): ......It took her quite some time before she pushed her unsatisfied feelings aside, and once again turned to face the guesthouse.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It took her quite some time before she pushed her unsatisfied feelings aside, and once again faced the guesthouse.
PC Japanese (JP): ……釈然としない気持ちを押さえ、再びゲストハウスに向き直るまで、彼女は短くない時間を掛けるのだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……釈然としない気持ちを抑え、再びゲストハウスに向き直るまで、彼女は短くない時間を掛けるのだった。
Russian (RU): ......Ей понадобилось некоторое время, прежде чем она оттеснила в сторону свои неутихшие подозрения, и она снова повернулась к домику для гостей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Levou bastante tempo antes dela deixar seus sentimentos de insatisfação de lado, e mais uma vez se virar para encarar a casa de hóspedes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……壓抑住並未釋然的心緒，重新轉身面向賓館，耗費了她一段不短的時間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……压抑住并未释然的心绪，重新转身面向宾馆，耗费了她一段不短的时间。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Le ci volle un po' prima che potesse mettere da parte quel senso di insoddisfazione, e poi ancora una volta, si volse verso la casa degli ospiti.
